article.headline: Mercer 78, North Florida 75
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- Brian Mills had a career-high 34 points and Jake Gollon scored four unanswered points in the final 14 seconds to lift Mercer to a 78-75 win over North Florida on Friday night. After the Ospreys pulled ahead 75-74 on an Andy Diaz layup with 29 seconds left, Gollon hit a jumper, blocked a shot and made two free throws with 4 seconds to go. Parker Smith's potential tying 3-pointer rattled around the rim without falling with 1 second left, giving the Bears (13-15, 10-7 Atlantic Sun Conference) their fifth straight win and a split of the season series. North Florida (10-18, 7-10), which beat Mercer 74-64 on Jan. 22, has lost four of five. Mills, who scored 22 second-half points, made 11 of 22 field goals while his teammates were a combined 14 of 43. Three Bears fouled out in the last 5:41. Brad Haugabrook scored 19 points and Jimmy Williams had 18 to pace the Ospreys.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
